content: least three pattern repeats 33 stitches is recommended this gives you a chance to learn the pattern and ensure that your cast on edge is sufficiently stretchy be sure to wash block and dry the swatch some yarns do unexpected things when washed of course you can throw caution to the wind and take the mitt is my swatch approach abbreviations k = knit yo = yarn over k2tog = knit two together sm = slide marker m1l = make one left a left leaning increase using the left needle pick up the bar between the needles from front to back and knit it through the back for great videos on how to do this increase go to knittinghelp com m1r = make one right a right leaning increase using the left needle pickup up the bar between the needles from back to front and knit it through the front go to knittinghelp com for helpful video instructions make 2 identical gloves cast on 44 stitches and join for working in the round a long-tail cast on is fine if you cast on loosely if you are making longer cuffs it is important to cast on loosely join for working in the round for a lovely circular cast-on and join head over to techknitter s blog at techknitting blogspot com and check out her 3 in 1 join her blog is a treasury of great techniques divide your stitches among your needles in groups of 11 for example on three dpns put 11 on needles one and two and 22 stitches on needle three on two circulars put 22 stitches on each needle the purpose of this is to keep the yos in the middle of the needles e wedaimonia etsy com page 3 baby fan mitts place a marker at the beginning of the round as you knit each round slide this marker to keep track of the beginning of the round cuff edging crochet edging is added after knitting is complete go directly to the cuff section row 1 knit row 2 purl row 3 knit row 4 purl cuff row 1 start baby fan lace pattern the lace is an 11 stitch pattern so you will be doing four repeats in each row see chart last page if you prefer k2tog k2tog yo k yo k yo k yo k2tog k2tog repeat four times for each row row 2 3 and 4 knit repeat these four row 5 times finishing with row 4 if you want a longer cuff and have enough yarn knit more repeats of the four row pattern ending with row 4 if you are using your first mitt as your swatch check your gauge now gusset overview detailed line by line written instructions follow and the entire gusset is charted the tricky part of the gusset is that you will do the gusset increases every 3rd row while doing the established lace pattern every 4th row the thumb gusset will be started by
